original: 2.   Ownership  by the  Company.  Turpin  acknowledges  and agrees that all Work Product  have been made for the Company  and that the Company  shall be the exclusive  owner  of all  right,  title,  and  interest  in and to the Work Product and all  Intellectual  Property Rights therein.  Turpin does hereby assign and transfer to the Company,  effective  upon  creation,  all right, title, and interest that Turpin may have in and to the Work Product and all Intellectual Property Rights therein and does hereby assign all of Turpin's future right,  title,  and interest that Turpin may have in and to each of the Work Product and Intellectual Property Rights therein, effective at the time each is created.  Turpin hereby  irrevocably  and expressly  waives as against  any  person all moral  rights  Turpin may have in any and all Work Product.
ollama_generated: 2. Exclusive Ownership by the Company. Turpin acknowledges and agrees that all Work Products were developed on behalf of the Company, and grants the Company the exclusive right to own, with no claim from Turpin, all rights, titles, and interests in, and to the Work Products and all Intellectual Property Rights associated therewith. Effective upon creation, Turpin assigns and transfers to the Company all rights, title, and interest that Turpin may have in and to the Work Products and Intellectual Property Rights, and also assigns any future rights, titles, and interests arising from the Work Products or Intellectual Property Rights. This assignment is binding, and Turpin irrevocably waives, as against any person, any moral rights Turpin may have in any and all Work Products, acknowledging that the Company shall have the sole discretion to exercise these rights.

original: 3.   Disclosure of Work Product. Turpin agrees to maintain at all times adequate and current  records  relating to the creation and development of the Work Product and  Intellectual  Property Rights  therein,  which records and all copies  thereof  shall be and shall  remain the  exclusive  property of the Company,  and to  disclose  all such  records  and  copies  to the  Company promptly.
ollama_generated: 3. Ownership and Maintenance of Work Product Records: Turpin acknowledges that any and all records associated with the generation and evolution of the Work Product and related Intellectual Property Rights shall be owned exclusively by the Company. Turpin is responsible for maintaining these records in a timely and up-to-date manner. However, at the Company's request, Turpin may be required to share these records and copies, but the Company will bear any costs associated with their production and transmission.

original: 9.   Amendment.  Waiver.  Variation.  No amendment,  waiver, or variation of the terms, conditions,  warranties,  covenants,  agreements or undertakings set out herein shall be of any force or effect  unless  reduced to writing duly executed  by all  parties  hereto  in the  same  manner  and  with the same formality as this Agreement is executed.
ollama_generated: 9. Modifications, Waivers, and Alterations. This Agreement may only be modified, waived, or altered if such modifications, waivers, or alterations are in writing and signed by all parties involved, with the same formality as this Agreement was executed. However, the failure to enforce any provision of this Agreement shall not constitute a waiver of that provision, nor shall it affect the validity of this Agreement as a whole.

original: 10.  Successors and Assigns. This Agreement shall be binding upon Turpin and the heirs and legal  representatives  of Turpin,  and shall be binding upon and ensure to the  benefit  of the  Company  and its  successors  and  assigns, including  any  corporation  with  which or into  which the  Company or its successors may be merged or which may succeed, to its assets or business.
ollama_generated: 10. Succession and Assignment: This Agreement shall be applicable to Turpin, as well as their respective heirs, executors, and legal representatives. Conversely, the Company is not bound by this Agreement for any specific period, and it may freely assign its rights and obligations under this Agreement to any successor or assignee, including corporations resulting from a merger with the Company, or taking over its assets or business.

original: 15.  Severability. The provisions of this Agreement, whether or not contained in the same section,  are independent and separable.  If any of the provisions of this Agreement shall be invalid or  unenforceable  under the laws of the jurisdiction   where   enforcement   is   sought,    such   invalidity   or unenforceability  shall not invalidate or render  unenforceable  the entire Agreement  but rather the entire  Agreement  shall be  construed  as if not containing the particular invalid or unenforceable  provision or provisions and the  rights and  obligations  of the  parties  shall be  construed  and enforced accordingly,  with the invalid or unenforceable provision modified so as to be limited and enforced to the fullest  extent  possible under the laws of that  jurisdiction,  with  retroactive  effect  to the date of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 15. Contingency Clause: The individual provisions of this Agreement, though not necessarily grouped within a single section, are self-contained and distinct. If any provision of this Agreement is deemed unenforceable or inapplicable in a particular jurisdiction due to its local laws, such invalidity shall not nullify the entire agreement. Instead, the court shall interpret and enforce the remaining provisions as if they had been drafted without the questionable provision, while upholding the rights and obligations of both parties according to the revised terms. The unenforceable or inapplicable provision shall be construed to the minimum extent possible under the jurisdiction's laws, with such modification applying retroactively to the effective date of this Agreement.

original: 17.  Headings  and  Gender.  The  headings  and  subheadings  contained  in this Agreement are used solely for  convenience  and do not constitute a part of the  Agreement,  nor  should  they  be  used  to aid in any  manner  in the construction  or  interpretation  of this  Agreement.  Unless  the  context requires  otherwise,  words  importing the singular  include the plural and vice versa and words importing gender include all genders.
ollama_generated:
17. Headings and Gender Interpretation:

The headings and subheadings in this Agreement serve for convenience only and do not form a binding part of the agreement. They should not be utilized in any way to infer or deduce the meaning or interpretation of the Agreement.

For the sake of clarity, unless specified otherwise, words encompass their plural and singular forms, as well as male, female, and non-binary genders throughout this agreement.

original: 18.  Counterparts  and Execution by Fax.  This  Agreement may be executed in any number of  counterparts  with the same effect as if' all the  parties  have signed the same document.  All counterparts shall be construed together and shall  constitute one agreement.  This Agreement may be validly executed by means of transmission of signed facsimile.
ollama_generated: 18. Multiple Signatories and Execution by Fax or Electronic Transmission. This Agreement can be signed by each party on separate copies, with each such copy having the same legal effect as if all parties had signed a single document. All signed counterparts shall be treated as a single agreement. For the purposes of this Agreement, execution may occur by facsimile transmission of signed pages or electronic transmission of signed digital copies.

original: 19.  Acknowledgement. Turpin has carefully read and considered the terms of this Agreement and,  having done so,  understands  the terms and agrees that the terms herein are fair and reasonable  and are  reasonably  required for the protection of the interests of the Company.
ollama_generated: 19. Acknowledgment. Turpin affirmatively states that they have given this Agreement a thorough review, comprehending its contents entirely, yet acknowledge that while the terms may seem favorable to the Company, they are not coerced into accepting them as equitable or necessary. The obligations herein are assumed voluntarily and without reservation by Turpin.
